text: Aagot Norman (29 July 1892 – 22 February 1979) was a Norwegian swimmer. She set two Norwegian records in 100m freestyle at the short course and she attended the 100m freestyle during the 1912 Summer Olympics.This was the first time swimming was on the program for women. She lost in the quarter-finals. == Norwegian national records by Aagot Norman == {| class="wikitable sortable" |- !width="100" align="center"|Event !width="100"|Result !width="150" align="center"|Date !width="100" align="center"|Location |- |100m freestyle |1.46,2 |1 September 1912 | Bergen |- |100m freestyle |1.49,2 |30 July 1911 | Bergen |} ==External links== *Aagot Norman - Olympic athlete profile at Sports-Reference.com Category:1892 births Category:1979 deaths Category:Sportspeople from Bergen Category:Norwegian female swimmers Category:Swimmers at the 1912 Summer Olympics Category:Olympic swimmers of Norway
title: Aagot Norman
